objects.name: Ransom Cartel Ransomware
objects.description:
Ransom Cartel is ransomware-as-a-service (RAAS) that surfaced in mid-December 2021. This ransomware performs double extortion attacks and exhibited several similarities and technical overlaps with REvil ransomware, which disappeared just a few months before Ransom Cartel surfaced, and just one month after 14 of its alleged members were arrested in Russia. At the time when Ransom Cartel first appeared it was unclear if it was a rebrand of REvil or if it was an unrelated threat actor who reused or mimicked Revil ransomware code.

During our research we observed Ransom Cartel encrypting both Windows and Linux VMWare ESXi servers in attacks on corporate networks.

objects.name: Ransom Cartel
objects.description:
Ransom Cartel was first observed in mid-December, 2021, and its first alleged victims were posted around late April 2022 including an India-based national oil company. Since then, Unit 42 has observed additional victims in the USA and France including victims in the following industries: Higher Education, Metal manufacturing, utility and energy.


Unit 42 has observed Ransom Cartel encrypting both Windows and Linux VMWare ESXi servers in attacks on corporate networks.
